value: %AppData% is a variable that refers to the file system directory that serves as a common repository for application-specific data on Windows systems.
Representing \"accessibility\" as \"a\" followed by 11 more letters, followed by \"y\".
The BBC Academy is the home for all BBC Training content, including courses and articles. This is the BBC Academy web presence.
A S3 hosted static website containing guides, guidelines and other resources concerning how to build accessible apps and websites.
CMS and JSON API used by BBC Education for creating/editing quizzes, retrieving quiz data and marking answers.

ADA uses linked data in order to create automated navigation between archive programmes. New onward journeys between programmes and automated aggregation of programmes around subjects, make it easier to find programmes of interest.
An interim solution to emulate notifications from Topcat2 to the Public Feeds Adaptor
ADIE is a new Metadata Ingest service to provide a flattened view of the PIPS programme hierarcy for a given Media Asset PID, in the form of an ADI XML document.
AEandP stands for Audio Edit and Playout system
Video Factory component responsible for creating .ism files for DRM assets.
A Shared Styleguide for iPlayer Radio
Amazon Machine Image. An encrypted machine image stored in Amazon Elastic Block Store or Amazon Simple Storage Service.
XML feeds consumed by third parties who wish to have access to audio-ondemand content.
Application Programming Interface.
File monitoring app which kick starts the File Based Delivery process for Mod Av Video Factory.
Automated Programme Support is a stack of systems which aims to automatically provide one page per BBC programme (brand, series, episode).
(Service Design) The structure of a System or IT Service, including the Relationships of Components to each other and to the environment they are in.
Amazon Resource Name. A standardized way to refer to an AWS resource. For example: arn:aws:iam::123456789012:user/division_abc/subdivision_xyz/Bob.
It is a binary repository/cache and proxy for Maven artifacts. At the BBC we wish to use it purely as a cache and proxy, but not as a repository.
Asset Staging Server
The meaning of this term is highly context based.
Formally Siemens
A service that helps the BBC make informed decisions based on what its consumers think, like and do
Audio Preview Maker (APM) generates 30 second audio snippets of tracks that are played on BBC Radio.
Auditor saves and returns notes and emails generated as part of the FBDS validation process.
The Auth Toolkit provides the ability for native mobile applications to sign-in, register, sign out and access user data using BBC ID.
Automatic playback of the \"next\" media content item, e.g. episode, in the end of the current one (not to be confused with \"autostart\")
Automatic start of playback when user is visiting playback URL (often referred to as \"autoplay\", however not to be confused with \"autoplay\").
Audio Visual Data Base
Web Service for cloud computing
B2B pusher sends programme metadata to 3rd parties.
Bagpuss is the component in Video Factory and Audio Factory that assembles video and audio chunks into high-resolution files, prior to transcoding.
Barrister is Video Factory's QC (Quality Control) filter.
If you want to SSH to a BBC machine, you have to SSH via a bastion machine.
Provide localized content with correct fonts
Mobile-first responsive website for thought-provoking video content organised into themed playlists.
The BBC Monitoring User Portal https://monitoring.bbc.co.uk (also known as BBCM Portal) is a commercial audience-facing website made available by BBC Monitoring to their customers.
See BBC Monitoring User Portal
See Volt
Reel

The BBC Search Adaptor will take the search information from CPS and send it to the search team in XML for cloud view to provide the functionality that is currently available in Topcat2, but will not be supported by CPS when Topcat2 migrates to CPS. This is for world service/language sites.
BBC Sport content presented in native iOS, Android and Kindle apps with additional mobile platform features
Business Continuity
Broadcast Data Feed.
Belfrage is the entrypoint for the WebCore framework.
BBC Internet Distribution Infrastructure
The bidibrain service is a replacement for bidi-controlplane.

Bidi-cc-listener receives data (e.g. routing preferences for IP prefixes) from BIDI caching cells and stores this information in S3. This information is later used to compute routing weights, which are published to the MatchMakers.
The Bidi-Controlplane service (or Bidi-mm-publisher) uses routing data and config information pulled from S3, and computes routing destination weights, which then publishes to the match makers
A high performance, scalable, resilient triplestore with robust OWL reasoning support.
BIOS (BBC iD OAuth Service)

The BBC Radio beta app for Blackberry handsets (OS 5-7.1) provides users with live and on demand audio services for National, Nations, and Local radio stations using the BBC's publicly available WMA streams service.
API that provides core metadata to iPlayer Radio products adding value by aggregating data from across BBC sources allowing client applications to perform in a timely and reliable manner
Bad Message Queue, the queue used to keep messages that are not correctly formatted or invalid in some other way.
A realmedia schedule tool for On demand programming which is provided to the BBC by Atos
Now called Delta. Essentially a heavily customized and optimized (continuous) FTP push service.
A PIPs programme definition within the PIPs metadata hierarchy.
An editorial tool to provide branding (color schemes + background images) to audience-facing applications.
A PIPs object encapsulating data about a specific broadcast of a Version of an Episode.
The BBC’s dedicated network for transmitting broadcast material over IP.
Brucey tells GTI if it should add a Bumper when transcoding files in Mez2VOD workflow.
Games hosting and embedding service for Children's Websites.
BBC internal term for units of work
The integration of CPS with the Dynamic Semantic Publishing (DSP) system.
The BBC World Service Integration Platform
Catalyst is responsible for deciding if, based on DynamoDB stream change events, a file in the File Based Delivery Strategic workflow should be sent for delivery (e.g. to Media Factory) or not.
Catapuss is a java application running in the cloud which polls the manifest file provided by Chunder and pulls the chunks listed into S3.
CBBC Responsive is the project name for the rebuild of the responsive CBBC website on an AWS platform.
CBeebies Playtime Island is a single purpose game app that regularly delivers, new, inclusive, quality gaming experiences for our audiences; built on the Pick n Mix framework.
CBeebies Responsive is the project name for the rebuild of the responsive CBBC website on an AWS platform.
Content Delivery Network
Alert from Limelight likely to be first warning.
CDN Origin servers are used for AV content being distributed via our CDN partners.
Consolidated Download Services
Chartbeat is a real time monitoring tool used by Journalists on the News site for a limited trial period in November/December 2013
The Children's Promo System is a scheduling and management system, for prioritising a wide range of promotions on the Children's websites.
Chunder is the part of Video Factory that runs on the Clowder and provides a manifest file listing all available chunks
BBC1 – continues with Olympics coverage
Command Line Interface. Method of interacting with software, as an alternative to an Application Programming Interface (API).
Clifton is a feed bridge for /programmes. It will enable the current Front End to read data from the database in advance of rebuilding it on the cloud.
SOASTA CloudTest Load testing and Performance testing tool managed by the Load Test team and installed within the on site Platform.
Amazon CloudWatch is a cloud-based monitoring service for AWS and other resources.

Clowder is the part of Video Factory and Audio Factory https://confluence.dev.bbc.co.uk/display/audiofactory/Audio+Factory that captures live video and audio from the CCMs (Central Coding and Mux) and slices it into chunks and uploads those chunks to a S3 bucket.
The Comments Module creates a consistent experience to commenting on articles across the BBC.
Companion App
The Connected Studio website hosts information pages about the Connected Studio team and their work
The Content API is a read only service that provides contextualised JSON versions of CPS content to PAL apps
API that allows access to all the CPS stories and move them to the XML content store.
An XML document store (database) where we will store all the content from the CPS
DR Room TVC
Manages deployments on the Cloud Platform
Content Product Engine.
Content Production System.
CPS Review renders unpublished articles created in CPS, to allow CPS users to preview content before it is published.
Connected Red Button
Cron Dispatcher is a Cosmos-deployed AWS Lambda triggered by a cron event. It generates and dispatchers messages to the SLI calculator fleet.
Croupier matches Media Selector's clients IPs to a set pre-defined Media Selector 6 configurations. It is designed as a backend service, not to be accessed directly by the end users.
Cucumber allows the execution of feature documentation written in plain text (known as user stories).
One line explanation of product
An internal editorial tool to create curated collections of content to audience-facing outlets.
Cable and Wireless Watford (Datacentre)
DAE = Direct Audience Engagement. This service contacts the audience (i.e. the public, licence fee holders) directly using technooges such as electronic newsletters.
Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH), also known as MPEG-DASH
A linear web TV platform
Site failover Authorisers are FM&T Operations Live Site team in conjunction with the Head of Operations and/or Controller OTG.
Deliverance is the final component in the File Based Delivery Strategic chain.It is responsible for moving media to it's final destination e.g. Media Factory.

The delivery chain is a complex system of queues used by applications running within the Reith network to deliver files from the Reith master content servers to the web servers on the Content network.
PCS AMP process that delivers EPG files to Sky
PCS process delivers EPG files to Sky
Delta Master Content Server
External Sport Media Company in charge of delivering Olympic related data around schedule, results, stats and production log information related to video.
The Queen celebrates 60 years as Monarch in 2012. The BBC will be going coverage crazy
System to streamline the workflow for publishing audio from Dira to BBC Online.
Discover (external name of \"Rewind\") is a search and discovery platform built to host archive content cleared and vetted by the Rewind archives team for public access.

Dispatcher is a AWS Lambda Component which requests a delivery of a file e.g. to playout or to Media Factory. Dispatcher also stores the status of a file as Requested in the Fbd Delivery Status Table.
Dead Letter Queue, the queue used to keep messages that we cannot process.
Domain Name System

Docker is an open-source https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open-source project that automates the deployment of Linux https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linux applications https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Application_software inside software containers https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_container.
The downloads.bbc.co.uk service is designed for delivery of large files over HTTP (e.g., PDF, .swf)
Disaster Recovery
Dynamic Semantic Publishing.
DSP API is the old name for TRiPOD API.
System that provides a public view of persistent BBC programme metadata
Dynamite Data Bridge (DDB) populates a database used by Dynamite from information in PIPs and Livestats.
DynamoDB is a NoSQL database included in the services provided by AWS.
EAVIS is a JSON API which brings together linked information about Events (e.g. Glastonbury, Radio 1 Big weekend etc), such as artists, their performances, reviews, promos and guides.
Elastic Block Store. A service that provides block level storage volumes for use with EC2 instances.
Amazon EC2 is a web service that provides resizeable computing capacity, literally servers in Amazon's data centres, that you use to build and host your software systems.
Echo is a unified interface to manage reporting of user interaction events and AV events, in BBC products.
Elastic Internet Protocol. A fixed (static) IP address that you have allocated in Amazon EC2 or Amazon VPC and then attached to an instance.
A service that associates EIPs https://confluence.dev.bbc.co.uk/display/GLOSSARY/EIP to component instances on the cloud
Elastic Load Balancing. A web service that improves an application's availability by distributing incoming traffic between two or more EC2 instances.
XML content repository and default publishing end point for iSite.
Salford Sport Encoders are using Elemental Live encoders to stream video over IP.
Third party transcoding software provided by Elemental Technologies
Embedded Media Player is a flash media player used in bbc.co.uk and for the wii iplayer.

An encoder is a device or software program or algorithm that converts information from one format or code to another, for the purposes of standardization, speed, secrecy, security, or saving space by shrinking size.
EPG Generator is an AWS Lambda maintained by the PCS AMP team which generates EPG Files.
EPG Transporter
Enhanced Programme ID (internal BBC identifier) for PIPs
A 'programme' that is generally broadcast, and for which OnDemands can be made available for, for which metadata such as titles, descriptions etc. exists.
The 6th edition of Javascript, officially known as ECMAScript 2015, was finalized in June 2015.
Makes BBC Feeds available to the PAL applications.
ESS (Echo Schedule Service) is a service for enriching reporting (via Echo) of live media streams (simulcasts) with metadata information.
Third party provided transcoding software, exposed via an API
The 2012 UEFA European Football Championship, commonly referred to as Euro 2012, will be the 14th European Championship for national football teams sanctioned by UEFA.
An EVENT is a defined Olympics discipline that occurs during a Video Session.
Also known as EST. This will be used to create the iVP video sessions in PIPs and DSP.
Command line tool to strip ID3 tags from MP3 files
Fast Agnostic Business Layer – the data transformation layer that powers WebCore
Fastly provide a commercial CDN product, which we are using for a proof of concept project for running international traffic via a CDN by default, as opposed to only during periods of high load.
Find A Track (Music)
Faucet ingests programme metadata from PIPS and Nitro and stores the information in a database which is then used by /programmes. It replaces TAPP.

Faustus performs health checks on the dynamic packagers. It periodically requests manifests from each packager running on live, and sends an alert to Zenos if any of the dynamic packagers fail. It also posts metrics to cloud watch.
File Based Delivery Strategic.  An in-house, cloud based replacement for FBDIA.Also know as FBD
UI onto the File Based Delivery Strategic workflow show file metadata, delivery details etc.  Also know as the FBD Dashboard.
Fenton is responsible for DOG (Digital Onscreen Graphic) control in Mez2VOD workflow.
Ferret updates AWS CloudSearch with changes made to the File Based Delivery Strategic dynamoDB instance so that these changes will show in the FBD Dashboard.
The London 2012 Festival http://www.bbc.co.uk/2012/festival is a single CPS special index page under 2012 Portal.
A proxy service that handles requests from the Universal Recommendations Chassis and forwards them to Datalab-hosted recommendation engines
A children's story writing competition run by Childrens and Education.
Forge is \"the Platform\" and the processes for developing applications on it.
Freebird is a platform to aggregate, analyse, find and curate content from the web.
unpublishes media which has been published through Video Factory
Galileo is the collective name for the workflow components of Clip Factory. It is a message orientated series of components that operate using AWS resources (EC2, SQS, SNS).

Galileo Autopub receives notifications of media being delivered to an S3 bucket, and for any media which matches a known key (filename), the media is published automatically through Galileo using pre-configured and auto-generated metadata. Upon completion of this publication (if configured) this can update Media in the CPS API enabling the replacement of Media on an existing MAP page.
A component of Galileo which transforms messages from Galileo Router into a format which allows interested subscribers to know when a new Clip was created and made available to the public.
The Galileo Image Publisher uses PIPS to publish images and relationships. It also copies images files to the expected destination storage if needed.
The Galileo Key Frame Extractor extracts a configurable number of images from the key frames of a video file that is put in the S3 input bucket of Galileo.
The Galileo Media Asset Publisher uses MAMI to publish transcoded, distributed assets to PIPs.
The Galileo Media Distributor interacts with MDJ for storing the video files in the right bucket
A component of Galileo which manages the workflows for publishing a Clip/Episode from a request to it
Galileo syndication publishes a video clip and its metadata through ftp to external service(s).
The Galileo Tag Publisher uses LDP to publish tag concepts related with a clip.
The Galileo Transcode Service sends information to GTI in order to transcode a video file
The Version Publisher creates the required entities in pips to initialise the publication of a clip
Gatekeeper's job is to move files in and out of the File Based Delivery Strategic file vault.  Nothing else is allowed to access that vault (s3 bucket)
Genres is an AWS component made by Knowledge & Learning to deliver index pages for the various K&L Genres to our end users.

GeoIP is a geo-locatory service which exists in the Forge service layer and as an AWS Cloud API. It has a simple HTTP API which accepts an IPv4 or IPv6 address RESTfully as a HEAD request, and returns geo-location information about that IP address in the HTTP response headers.
Globalsocial provides an automated workflow for streaming video to social media platforms.
Goat is a Video Factory service that calculates MD5 checksums for media assets.
Go CBBC is a native Android, iOS and Kindle app for  phones and tablets.
Gon is Video Factory's SQS queue management console.
Video Factory Generic Transcode Interface
GTI back-end that uses Elemental to transcode media
GTI back-end that uses Amazon Elastic Transcode Service (ETS) to transcode media
Splits and sends GTI transcode request to relevant back-ends for transcoding
Global Traffic Management
Adobe's HTTP Dynamic Streaming protocol enables high-quality (H.264 or VP6), network-efficient HTTP live streaming for media delivery.
a Head Check is an HTTP Head Request to determine whether or not a resource exists on a server
Apple's HTTP Live Streaming protocol. It’s popular since it provides the only way to deliver advanced streaming to iOS devices.
HLSRTP is an component in the live streaming workflow which converts HLS input (HTTP) into RDP packets and sends these on via UDP. It is used to supply Omnia audio encoders with input.
Identity and Access Management. A web service that enables Amazon Web Services customers to manage users and user permissions within AWS.
International Broadcast Centre: The media hub of the London 2012 Olympics
iBL is the API for iPlayer. It is the single source of iPlayer data for clients on the web, mobile and TV.
iBroadcast is a video encoding tool used for short form video clips.
A replacement for icar
Ice provides a birds-eye view of our large and complex cloud landscape from a usage and cost perspective.
Mobile-first responsive website for thought-provoking video content organised into themed playlists.
An iSite-based CMS for creating interactive content for News website.
An React application for journalist to produce discreet embeddable content, to be include in BBC Articles, for delivery to all platforms in a variety of fortmats
One line explaination of product
Image Chef is a graphics manipulation tool that allows a given transformation to be applied to one or more images.

acronym: In Our Time Linked Data Beta
value: A public-facing 'Beta' version of the archive for Radio 4's 'In Our Time' to test and share the experience offered by using Linked Data.
Ingests travel data from Inrix.
The instance data management tool is used to curate data (terms such as teams and players / athletes, all the different ontologies) held in the TRiPOD triple store.
IDL provides a single customer view for analysis and insight.
BBC Introducing allows artists to get their music heard by the BBC
International Olympic Committee
BBC iPlayer is part of bbc.co.uk and it allows you to watch the TV on your computer.
This is a simple Forge PAL app for serving config files to the iPlayer iOS and Android native mobile apps.
Monitors the behaviour of the Mobile iPlayer apps in production
iPlayer Xbox One is an iPlayer for TV V1 (also referred to as V4) web application, packaged and deployed as a native application for the the Microsoft Xbox One console.
An enabling technology used by other teams to build their products then transfer content from REITH to FORGE, via the means of a asynchronous queue.
iPlayer Radio
Internet Protocol Television.
Its an install of the Alfresco http://www.alfresco.com CMS for Forge.
iSpy is the Media Publishing team's event logging system, designed to allow business-logic level transitions to be recorded in such a manner that they can be tracked in Splunk.
iStats is the BBC's single online measurement system. As of July 2011, iStats is the official measuring and reporting tool for all of BBC Online.
Intelligent Video Player.
The PAL Page that hosts the IVP. It has several modes (i.e. default, accessible, iPad)
A Pop out version of the PAL Page that will host a smaller custom version of the IVP.
Japer
JavaScript Object Notation.
The Juicer is a news aggregator continuously fetching news articles from more than 500 publishers around the world.
JustConfigurator is a component that periodically syncs static assets (such as configuration) from subversion to target locations. It currently supports syncing to S3 and WebDAV volumes.
Application to create and serve image-based websites for clients using phones that could not otherwise render the web site(s).

The Kholkikos Drakon was the ever awake serpent that guarded the Golden Fleece http://greekmythology.wikia.com/wiki/Golden_Fleece in a grove sacred to Ares in Kolkhis. When the Argonauts came to aquire the Fleece, they had to get past it. There are two theories as towards how they past the Drakon, either Medea put the monster to sleep so Jason could grab the fleece while it slumbered or Jason slew it.  There is also a belief that the monster swallowed Jason and then regurgitated him thanks to th
Kit updates AWS CloudSearch with events from the File Based Delivery Strategic delivery status database.  This means that those events become visible in the FBD Dashboard.
key performance indicators (KPIs) identified by the Product Owner and Editorial
The Key Value Store is a RESTful database.
BBC Learning English has been inspiring learners of English since 1942 and helping our global audience learn English.
A Content Delivery Network (CDN) provider formerly used by the BBC
Litmuss updates or creates a DynamoDB entry which records the arrived status of a file in the File Based Delivery Strategic workflow.
An FM Sport service to provide fast and efficient data delivery to the Live Experience application
The FM&T Journalism \"Live Event Experience\" project aims to develop systems and components to improve the online coverage of live events on the BBC News and Sport sites:
Live Event Stream
An FM Cloud Hosted service to provide fast and efficient data delivery of data from forge services to the clients.
The video wall installation in Liverpool is to provide a disaster recovery facility for the 24/7 operation desk in Salford.
An FM Sport service to provide an API to create Live Coverages for systems other than CPS
Locator is a web service that enables search for locations, and returns data about those locations.
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games

Lovett receives GTI requests from Pedant for manual trimming. It sets proxy copy in the messages' profiles, overwrites reply to field with Todd Trim queue, and sends the modified GTI requests to GTI for transcoding.
Lumberjack chops up logs, geddit?
Lush uses UAS to rank entities by according appropriate popularity metrics (eg. follows, favourites).
The Media Availability Database, is used to manage media availability and service information.
Connected Studios MakerBox discussion forum aims to bring together a collection of innovative technologies from BBC R&D and third party suppliers.
Connected Studios MakerBox web site aims to bring together a collection of innovative technologies from BBC R&D and third party suppliers.
Summary
Media Asset Page
Media Availability Panel
The MTK is a Javascript library that allows maps to be displayed within a html document.

The Content Store (MarkLogic) is a NoSQL style persistent storage solution for storing textual, <xml/>, HTML, binary and other such unstructured assets. It is planned that various assets are to be made persistent within MarkLogic's schema independent content store.
Marvin is a live streaming media production tool to be used by the Audio Video Producers (AVP) in the Sports Multimedia Team.
The BIDI Matchmaker is the 'front door' to the BIDI CDN, redirecting users to appropriate BIDI batteries.
Mattress (Media Asset Translater) translates Transcode Complete messages from GTI and converts them to (ModAV not Pips) Media Asset messages.
MDJ is a program used for manipulating (read/write/copy/list) files (local/ftp/S3/delta)
Multichannel Distribution Service: Used for the distribution of video/audio feeds from the IBC.
The product to deliver AV media to BBC Online
Open Source software used to fetch metadata from media files
MediaReuser is a Video Factory metadata component in Live2OD workflow.
Media Selector is the front-end service application providing required media information to user-facing client application such as EMP and iPlayer Desktop enabling them to access media assets.
Media Services https://confluence.dev.bbc.co.uk/display/MediaServices/Media+Services+Product is the team responsible for publishing all BBC AV media produced for IP platforms.
\"Media Watch\" was the original working title for the BBC Monitoring website http://www.bbc.co.uk/monitoring, launched in August 2014.
Distributed memory caching system (deployed multi datacenter)
Merl receives mediaflex rejection emails and passes them on for processing by the File Based Delivery Strategic workflow
An application, consisting of many message queues (MQ) and/or topics
Message Queue. Part of the Olympics data architecture that will receive and process the Olympic related messages delivered by DeltaTre.
is data about data

Multi-Factor Authentication. An optional AWS account security feature. Once you enable AWS MFA, you must provide a six-digit, single-use code in addition to your sign-in credentials whenever you access secure AWS web site pages or the AWS Management Console.

The Micro Bit is an initiative by the BBC to encourage all year 7 students in the UK to start coding as part of the Make It Digital Season. The project delivers a coding website and programmable hardware in partnership with organisations such Microsoft and ARM.
Masterbrand Identifier
Mobile Accessibility Developer Guidelines Site
iPlayer application for Android (tablet/phone including Amazon Kindle Fire) and iOS (iPhone/iPad/iPod) devices.
An older name for Media Services and Media Factory
Moderation service is used to feed submissions from various sources to the moderation platform in order to approve or reject them as BBC appropriate.
Monk handles timings settings for the Mez to VOD workflow.

Morph is a resilient, high-performance cloud-based service that offers both prepared JSON/XML data, and rendered HTML components, through independent, connectable templates. It's effectively a micro-services platform where each service (template) is written in JavaScript, creating HTML using React.
MoxyProxy is a component which allows Democracy Live encoders behind a filewall that only does destination IP address filtering to deliver to CDN endpoints with dynamic address.
Mozart is a \"page composition as a service\" platform, hosted on AWS.
The Media Publishing System (MPS) is responsible for producing renditions (copies in different formats) of AV clips that journalists submit.
System to report all music that has been used in the making of any published content.
Mandatory Sign In (or MSI for short) refers to a decision by the Executive Board in May 2015 to require users to sign in to BBC apps and websites in order to access content.

The mt-amp-ingester is a component that takes updates sent from the amp team and saves that data into the mt-broadcast-data-storage component. It is written in Java and deployed into AWS in the cloud using EC2 and SQS. It also communicates and searches PIPS to match data coming from amp to existing data.
A PAL application responsible for rendering iSite content for music related articles.
MusicBrainz https://musicbrainz.org/ on AWS is implementation of Musicbrainz's Slave and Search APIs on AWS for the BBC.
A PAL application responsible for displaying information around music related clips.

Music Events is an AWS-hosted web application serving pages under www.bbc.co.uk/events http://www.bbc.co.uk/events which brings together linked information about Events (e.g. Glastonbury, Radio 1 Big weekend etc), such as artists, their performances, reviews, promos and guides.

acronym: Music Events Application (no longer in use)
value: TV application for music events, such as Glastonbury or Radio 1 Big Weekend.
A single page app hosted on morph aimed to encourage patients with dementia to reminisce by triggering memories from music snippets. AKA Memory Music.
AWS web app that provides tracks pages for BBC Music

The Media Availability Panel surfaces on '/programmes' Brand pages for all BBC Radio and Television programmes. It is designed to quickly and immediately convey the availability status of any BBC programme in all of its possible forms of consumption. These include traditional broadcasting methods, viewing/listening online, downloads, and programmes available to buy. The panel prioritises information about the newest of new programmes first.
Network Address Translation. A method of assigning a private address to a server (following RFC 1918), and in some cases, a public address.
Displays promotional content in ORB on the footer of the page

The News Data Platform is an ESB-based service hosted in the cloud using Amazon Web Services.  It is designed to ingest, process and publish data for News applications such as Elections, Market Data, flood data. Data is accessible directly through a APIs or -currently
The product provides BBC website visitors an opportunity to subscribe for newsletters by signing in to, or registering for a BBC iD and clicking a newsletter subscription button.
News Recommendations API  is a content recommendations engine for news articles published to BBC's Content store:  Content Store Live https://confluence.dev.bbc.co.uk/display/cps/Content+Store+Live.
Network Home Pages (Radio)
This is a project to add composition ability to Tinara
Nitro currently provides a RESTful API for retrieving programme metadata, with XML and JSON representations available
Nitrogen is a PHP/PAL module wrapper around Nitro, to make it easier to create URLs and requests.
Batch based application that calls Nitro to retrieve programme and availability data before converting it into AOD feeds and uploading them to an S3 bucket.
BBC Notes is a system for producing, distributing and presenting synchronised programme notes in real-time alongside live performances or programmes.

Notifications is a system that provides signed in audience members with alerts for content they are interested in, when it becomes available. Notifications can be surfaced to users across a range of mediums but will be starting with responsive web and mobile push.
On Air Panel
OAS
An optional state for the radio network homepages, in which they will display obituary details of a category 1 death as opposed to their usual content.
Process for dealing with the death of a key member of the Royal family (Category 1 Obituary) which has been classified as a Tier 1 event.

Olympics Data Feed
On Demand Manager
Objectives and key results.
ModAV's instance Jenkins instance, running on the cloud platform
An API onto the Content Store, for the provision of Olympic data and event statistics.
The Olympics Data Service comprises multiple products.
The Olympics Feed Receiver is a web application to which our external data provider, DeltraTre, connects to provide data.
Takes messages off the queues and posts the data into TRiPOD and the Content Store.
Olympic Services 2012 is a Forge PHP web application (PAL) that delivers dynamic web page templates for the BBC Sport Olympic 2012 web site.
Serves up the Olympics instance data (team, athletes, disciplines) to the PAL application.
Olympic News Channel
Ontologies are classification schemes.
One Responsive Barlesque
Web Ontology Language (OWL) is a family of knowledge representation languages for authoring ontologies.
Family of semantic repositories, or RDF database management systems
Own It is the audience facing name for www.bbc.com/ownit. http://www.bbc.com/ownit. This is powered by the Stay-Safe webapp.

/programmes is the website www.bbc.co.uk/programmes. Version 2 is PAL based. Version 3 is AWS based and may also be known as \"/programmes Frontend\". During migration to AWS, routing decisions for /programmes are handled by the \"Find-by-pid proxy\" routing layer
Initially PHP, Apache & Composer
Packman is the entry to the FBDS process. It handles new file arrivals, giving them a unique package id which they'll keep for life.
Pagemon is a visual aid to 24/7 of URL endpoints as viewed from outside of the BBC
Page Assembly Layer is responsible for assembling pages and rendering them for consumption by client applications
World Service Site  The BBC World Service’s Business Development department runs the BBC World Service Partners website (“Website”).
Paulette is the Video Factory component responsible for sending publishing requests to MDJ and for writing metadata to PIPs
CBeebies Playtime Island is a single purpose game app that regularly delivers, new, inclusive, quality gaming experiences for our audiences; built on the Pick n Mix framework.
Programme Information Change Router (PICR, pronounced \"Picker\")
The Programme IDentifier
Pipette lets the File Based Delivery Strategic workflow know a new file has arrived in S3.
The metadata store for the BBC's public-facing programme information for multi-platform distribution.
PIT provides access to the details of programmes and their broadcasts and ondemand data, through various navgiation including schedule and a-z views.
PlaySpace is a project to bring together all the different ways of playing audio back into iplayer radio

Programme Metadata Pipeline (PMP) is the system that is responsible for the transfer of all relevant version and program metadata stored in PIPs into DAX for product reporting and into SCV for data enrichment.
Podcrawler is a script responsible for accumulating Podcast http://www.bbc.co.uk/podcasts information
Portishead was an export API that exports radio and music content items to 3rd parties. It's now deprecated.
The layer of WebCore responsible for the front-end audience experience, using the React framework to create a Single Page Application (SPA) for the BBC.
A tool the performs commissioning, scheduling, compliance and programme metadata for the majority of BBC radio stations.
See Taster.
Pull Request
PST is a production system allowing editorial staff to check Playlister favourites data for an episode, brand or masterbrand.
Generates atom indices for World Service indices on content publish.

Pubstack is an AWS based application service infrastructure developed by the WW Features development team.  Its purpose is to host Features websites (BBC.com http://BBC.com Earth, Travel etc) and to integrate them with an upstream instance of the iSite2 CMS used by feature editors.
Pulp is an API that provides personal data to BBC Music, adding value by aggregating data from across BBC sources allowing BBC Music apps to perform in a timely and reliable manner
Pulsar serves the BBC News and Sport live event pages, providing real-time commentary and statistical updates.
Pyxis is a centralised logging service for Components in the Cloud.

Pyxis Aggregator is a service that acts as an intermediate resilient buffer of log messages sourced from a variety of cloud services (Components in Cosmos terminology) and destined for: (i) Pyxis and (ii) S3.
Quality Assurance and Integration. Virgin TV iPlayer system that receives metadata and assets from BBC
GEOIP lookup database (geographic location based on IP address)
Providing example MPEG DASH Media to industry for testing and development purposes.
Radio Bridge processes images, based on entries in data feeds from both PIT (typically a few hundred new images added per hour, day and night) and iBroadcast2.
BBC's Service Information for Hybrid Digital Radios, also known as RadioEPG.
RadioTAG is a protocol specified by the RadioDNS project that allows digital radio listeners to interact with broadcasters by providing a back-channel over the internet.
Radix is the on-premises caching layer sitting between the CDNs (e.g. Akamai, Limelight) and the Media Services Origins (e.g. Video Factory S3 distribution bucket). It replaces CDS.
Radlord manages the DNS pools that load balance traffic to Radix machines.
Resource Description Framework.
Amazon RDS is a web service that makes it easier to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud.
The Recrypter is a reusable component that provides cross product message re-encryption between products using SQS/SNS. This product aims to be reusable, configurable and good looking.
John Reith was the founder of the BBC. Reith is now used as the name for multiple BBC projects.
Representational State Transfer
Reverb receives on air data from AMP, stores it in S3 and makes it available to FBDS.
Microservice, part of Media Services' Common Encryption DRM workflow
Rights Holding Broadcaster
Ria is the replacement FTP service for Delta.
Radio, Music and /Programmes  Also known as the Radio and Music Product Group
Radio Music Services
A product that performs distribution jobs for POD Publishing Services.
Rorschach is Video Factory's Ops Console. It aggregates status from other components to give an overview of Video Factory's media delivery.
Amazon Web Services Domain Name System (DNS) web service.

RPM Package Manager (RPM) (originally Red Hat Package Manager; now a recursive acronym https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recursive_acronym) is a package management system https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Package_management_system

Real Time Messaging Protocol (RTMP) was initially a proprietary protocol developed by Macromedia for high-performance streaming of audio, video and data over the Internet, between a Flash player and a server.
Real User Monitoring RUM is a monitoring system that provides a number of APIs to products to provide \"near real time\" information related to user activity.
Rutherford is a Video Factory service that splits Transcode Requests.
Amazon S3 is a cloud-based storage service for AWS.
Sport are using Elemental Live encoders to stream video over IP.
Sawmill monitors the consumption of Simulcast AV streams and creates an alert when the number of concurrent viewers/listeners drops below a configured threshold.
Scheduling software used by Radio Operations for studio and ob scheduling

Seismometer updates the File Based Delivery Strategic delivery status database with the results of attempted file movements.  We expect success.  We sometimes get failure (i.e. the file did not reach its final destination for some reason).
Java services API layer.
An email sending service hosted on AWS
A product agnostic video page built for the whole of the BBC on the Webcore platform.
The Share buttons are simple, embeddable webpage components to enable social sharing functionality for BBC websites.
Shared libraries are libraries that are loaded by programs when they start.
Shorthand is used for Longform \"prestige\" story-telling on BBC
Service Identifier
The Signiant http://www.signiant.com/ Agent is basically an FTP program on steroids.
Programmes on BBC One, Two and Three are available to watch online live and on demand via products like iPlayer.
Generates sitemap xml files for search engines to index.
Creates XML sitemaps for pan BBC sites as used by search engines for SEO purposes.
WFE-Skyp (\"Sky Packager\") is an internal back-end application which packages up video, images and metadata for delivery to the Sky Anytime+ platform, in VRP format.
Sky Red Button iPlayer Link allows the addition of a link to the Red Button bridge that provides the ability to launch into the BBC iPlayer section of Sky’s Anytime+ video on demand service.
Sky Rocket is a new deployment of the Rocket code base.
Skyver is a back-end service for transferring files from S3 to the local (or any mounted) filesystem.
Calculator BigQuery
Calculator CloudWatch
Calculator Sumo
Senior Leadership Team
Standard Media Player provides playback consistency to our audiences across multiple platforms and devices with cohesive look, feel and behaviour
A notification service hosted on AWS
Applications use SonicMQ to exchange information across local networks and the Internet.
Sport Olympic Services 2012 (SOS2012) is a Forge PHP web application (PAL) that delivers dynamic web pages for the BBC Sport Olympic 2012 web site.
The BBC audio offering, aka Combined Audio Product (Radio + Music combined).
Native mobile client application for the BBC Sounds service
Sonos Service implementation for BBC Sounds
Slash Programmes Asynchronous Nitro Enhancement Layer
An RDF query language SPARQL Protocol and RDF Query Language
A service layer application which abstracts a natural language concept extraction service and presents a RESTful API to the Graffiti tagging tool.
Spieler handles converting email requests into actual emails, and sending them via Amazon SES
The Spindle service deploys static assets (usually web page furniture such as images and CSS) for Cosmos components.
Splunk is the tool used to collect and index Video Factory business events, so that they can be queried.
The TVP Sport Data Aggregation Service also known as \"Sportacus\"
Sport Refresh is the project name for a redesigned BBC Sport web and mobile site
The TVP Sport Provider also known as \"SportView\"
A message queue system hosted on AWS
Squid is the front door to the Reverb DynamoDB table
Server Side Cookie is a key component in setting a first party cookie in order to identify browsers in data sent to comScore DAx, the BBC's analytics provider
a tool used by ModAV to diff and selectively merge proposed CloudFormation templates against whatever CloudFormation templates are in Int/Test/Live
Stay Safe is the Scala web app for the Own It website, which can be found at www.bbc.com/ownit https://www.bbc.com/ownit.
Stingray Traffic Manager
One line explaination of product
The Storytime app is an app built in Air and available via Google Play, Apple App Store and Amazon Store for installation onto phones, iPods and tablets.
Subverter is a component in Video Factory which converts subtitles from the STL format into the TTML format and pushes them to S3.
sup is a command line tool which uploads a file provided to Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3)

Syndication Engine Adapter transforms World Service content created in Topcat into XML feeds for external partners. These feeds are provided to the Reith application Syndication Engine which handles the actual syndication of the content.
TAG is the Technical Architecture Governance for myBBC.
TAPP ingests PIPs and PIT metadata into the /programmes v1 database
An audience facing space where the BBC will put new innovative ideas, these ideas will include a lot of existing pilots from Connected Studio.
Telstra London Hosting Centre (Datacentre), Docklands
Terms Matcher is the filter that detects profanities, personal information or contentious text.
The Space website is a virtual \"gallery\" for digital artworks.
Synonym for Weather https://confluence.dev.bbc.co.uk/display/GLOSSARY/Weather
Timelines is an AWS component made by Knowledge & Learning to deliver the timeline content format to our end users.
Originally stood for This Is Not A Reference Application.
Top Level Editorial Containers (TLECs) is also occasionally used to refer to the subset of TLEOs which are brands and series (i.e. not orphan episodes).
Top Level Editorial Object  A term to describe all the objects at the top of their trees (These could be series, brands, episodes)
Todd is Video Factory's trim, identification and QC console.
A web based authentication service for BBC applications which can be used by BBC users on their desktop or their own device and supports two-factor authentication.
Multilingual, web-based content management system.
Topic Pages display Linked Data concepts in the News (and shortly also Sport) website.
The Torch Relay Live is a PAL application offering information about each of the 70 days the torch travels around the UK.

Trickle updates AWS DynamoDB with 'Series Title' upon receiving insert event from the File Based Delivery Strategic delivery status database.  This means that for those events 'Series Title' becomes visible in the FBD Dashboard
Format for storing and transmitting data in an RDF model.
A triplestore is a purpose built database for the storage and retrieval of metadata (tags).
The cluster of apps made up by Triple Store, SPICE & TRiPOD API.
A series of API's that allow teams to query data in the triple store to create products.
VideoFactory components emit iSpy events, for monitoring / debugging / ad-hoc reporting. Turncoat delivers those events to Splunk.
Twiki is a monitoring system for Radix and BIDI.
User Activity Service
The User Activity Client library enables products to seamlessly integrate with UAS
Usher sits at the entry of the FBDS process. It moves files from an arrival S3 bucket to an intermediate S3 bucket.

USP enables audio and video streams to be consumed as HLS, HDS, Smooth and MPEG-DASH automatically. USP is a third party application provided by Code Shop http://www.unified-streaming.com/ http://www.unified-streaming.com/.
Varnish is a caching HTTP proxy deployed between the ZXTM and PAL servers.
Verity is a Java service that takes data from the iPlayer Business Layer (IBL) and provides device specific programme feeds for front-end TVP clients that require iPlayer content.
A PIPs programme definition within the PIPs metadata hierarchy.
A videosession is the period of editorial interest
customer profile resolver
The product provides a web server hosting the majority of the Red Button service's data for the Virgin Liberate (non-Tivo) cable TV platform.
Video on Demand
The Voice product is the BBC's offering for compatible voice assistant enabled platforms
An unique user identifier used by the Voice & AI team, which maps back to a BBC Account identifier.
The BBC Monitoring Volt tool (also known as BBCM Volt) is a BBC-internal website that allows BBC Monitoring journalists to view news video alongside its transcript and to search within transcripts.
Virtual Private Cloud. A web service that enables you to create a virtual network for your AWS resources.
Virtual Traffic Manager

The BBC's Web Application Framework, focussed on providing a framework for highly reusable front end components, for sharing between products. Also responsible for the necessary underlying platforms; primarily Morph and Mozart.
BBC Weather websites and apps
Twitterbot-based service.
Allows users to login and submit generate a Weather report within their area
Provides a means for editorial teams to discover, promote and moderate content for the Weather Watchers public site.
API for Weather Watchers reports and users.
Handles Subject Access Requests (SAR) for Weather Watchers.
A shared set of tools and practices to reduce duplication and increase our speed at delivering a personalised audience experience.
wham is a command line tool that bridges the gap between Jenkins and cosmos.
The Workflow Engine (WFE) delivers Video On-Demand (VOD) for iPlayer.
Provides mediated access to a selection of World Service and Domestic Radio podcasts.
World Service Topic Pages are used to display a list of CPS articles corresponding to a TIPO topic.
Wormhole is a service to provide a federated access proxy to the AWS console
Scripts submission system for script writers
At Home Locator
Extensible Markup Language.
YAML Ain't Markup Language.

YISS is an interim system to cover the encoding of the BBC Arabic and BBC Persian simulcast YouTube streams between the TwoFour platform being decommissioned, and Video Factory taking over the role. It is not expected to be in operation for more than 6 months from January 2020.
Yum is an automatic updater and package installer/remover for rpm systems.
Zaphod is designed to stream video at high volume.
A customisable component library for PHP programmers, used to fetch, render and display content
Zenoss http://www.zenoss.com/product/systems-management is the main OTG Home monitoring tool.
Zeus Extensible Traffic Manager. Load Balancers
